utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Yeah, I said I'm sorry. I'm just not feeling too hot.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: You're sneezing. You can do that at a movie theatre.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Yeah, and I'll be in a nice old chair when I collapse. I'm exhausted, babe.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Oh, come on! We're gonna be late! Episode Four never comes to the big screen. This is the pre-Lucas-ised version, remember? None of that "Greedo shooting first" crap.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Go without me.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: What are you talking about? You love Star Wars. Don't you?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Ben…

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Since just before I started pretending I loved it.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I was just trying to be supportive.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Fine. I'll go alone.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Baby, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Me too. I'm so woozy I can hardly think.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: We'll hang out at home.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: No, you should go.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Did you just feel something?

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Feel? Like what?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Is there an earthquake?

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: In New Jersey?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: I think I'm, like…

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: …hallucinating.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Call 911.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Twenty-six-year-old female, gas main exploded under her building, she was pulled out of the rubble after six hours.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Two surgeries for multiple fractures and burns.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm thinking the broken bones are a response to the building falling on her head.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: And the fever? She's the only collapse victim whose body temperature…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Put her on antipyretics.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Already have. The fever's holding at a hundred-and-four. Fluctuating consciousness.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Can't take the case. I don't have a team.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: So hire a team.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What for? I don't have a case.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Have you even interviewed anybody?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You test drive a car before you buy it. You have sex before you get married. I can't hire a team based on a ten-minute interview. What if I don't like having sex with them?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You've spent the last two weeks doing absolutely nothing. Concert is over.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: In what twisted universe does mastering Eddie Van Halen's two-handed arpeggio technique count as absolutely nothing?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Take the case or you will spend the next month helping the collapse team change bandages.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I diagnose her… alone… by the end of the day, you go away for a week.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's not gonna work.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: If he solves the case, we cure the girl.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: And prove he doesn't need a team.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: He's not gonna solve the case. Not that fast.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Because he needs a team! And this'll prove to him…

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You wanna change his mind about something, you need a more convincing argument than "You promised."

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fever. Non-responsive to antibiotics and antipyretics.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fluctuating consciousness. Go!

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: You talking to me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Imagine that… the roof of the storage closet collapses on your favorite… floor buffer. Which then starts overheating.

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: Why would I have a favorite floor buffer?

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: Okay. Maybe the electrical works got banged up in there from stuff falling on it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hmm, interesting. Brain damage leading to hypothalamic dysregulation.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nah. If you're brought in covered in rubble, it's all about the MRIs. We'd have seen that. C'mon! Gotta earn that fiver.

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: Or stuff leaked in the holes, messing it up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Lacerations leave multiple portals for infection. Bacteria would've responded to the antibiotics. 'S too high for viral.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Parasites or fungus is possible.

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: Or maybe lupus.

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: My grandma has lupus.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, autoimmune. I'll run a lupus panel. Infection fits best. Complete history would be helpful. Which leads to the worst part of the job.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Dealing with the floor buffer's family.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: No farms, no travel anywhere weird.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You get that, Dr. Buffer?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The file says she was sick before the building collapsed.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: I figured it was just a cold. Why, do you think it's related?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Her being sick and her being sick? Often is.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: She was unconscious when I found her.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: We'd been fighting. I just wanna… Just tell me she's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not even sure you're gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Show-off.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You know how the laughter of little children is infectious? Well, parasites and fungi are even more so. We're gonna find out which one is making her brain bubble over.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: EPA's doing that job for us. They say it's clean. Which means we're making a pilgrimage to Castle Blackberry.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No need. I'm sure we can find a large rock somewhere.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I got some loose change here says you don't.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Where's the restaurant?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What restaurant?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: The one you said you were taking me to for lunch.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh. Uhhh, this one's homier. Dibs on the cold pizza.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I'm sure it looked easier on YouTube.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah, you don't need a team. You can't even get arrested without company.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're right. Only one solution. Never replace them. Ever.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Do you need help?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, patronize the poor cripple.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Ow.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Lemme… get that.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Will you… let me… just let me get it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll check the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Some interesting mold on the windowsill here! It's gonna take me a while.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I'll cover the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She had a secret diary.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Is there any other kind?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: There's a sale on Liquid Tide.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If you're broke, I can lend you a tiny bit of the money I owe you.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: No, no, I wouldn't put you in that position. What does the diary say?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It's basically a list of her sexual encounters. Boys, girls, vibrating appliances.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: If it was, you'd be quoting, not summarizing.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: This is a parade of sad banalities. "I can hardly get out of bed. Feeling blue." Then, three months ago, turns into a parade of happy banalities. "Starting to turn the corner. Job's looking up."

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: We can stop swabbing. Her clichés are getting healthier.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Or she's less depressed. Aren't there pills that do that?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Antidepressants don't cause fever.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not on their own. But the ER Didn't know she was on MAO Inhibitors, so they gave her demerol. 'S a nasty combo.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: So all you have to do is convince this kid that his girlfriend had a secret doctor, and a secret stash, and a secret life. It's been a while since a patient took a swing at you. Can I watch?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I only have to convince the mother. Actually… I don't have to convince anyone.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: This it total crap. If she was seeing a psychiatrist, I'd know. If she was on drugs, I'd know.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Stop saying that.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: He's a janitor?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: More significantly, a blabbermouth.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: House, shut up! I am… very sorry how Dr. House handled this. It is completely unforgivable.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Except if he's right.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Dialysis will filter her blood.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: There's nothing to filter.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Save her life.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: She wasn't depressed.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: "I'm miserable around Ben."

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not me. I like Ben. February 12th. Either she's depressed, or she just thinks you're a jerk. Neither suggests that you should be the one directing her medical treatment.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, but medically…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's probably hiding them in her purse. I thought it'd be rude to go searching under a thousand tons of rubble.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: This was months ago. We were in a fight. Doesn't mean she's depressed and it doesn't mean she doesn't love me.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine, maybe the diary proves nothing. On the other hand, half the country's on antidepressants. And it fits her symptoms perfectly.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No ring on your daughter's finger means you make the decisions.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You really wanna risk her life on how well _he_ knows her?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson, you idiot.

utterance.speaker: THE GUITARNAPPER
utterance.content: Listen carefully, and no one will get hurt.

utterance.speaker: THE GUITARNAPPER
utterance.content: You must follow these instructions.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Any attempt to contact the FBI or other law enforcement agencies, or… Cuddy, will be met with…

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: …and a large Coke. No ice.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Give it back.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Did someone… kidnap your guitar?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Your twelve-thousand-dollar 1967 Flying V? Or something?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Where'd you hide it?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I am flattered you would consider me this bold and brilliant.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, it takes a cr…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It takes a criminal mastermind to pull off a heist from an unlocked, unguarded room down the hall. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Me? Nothing. But I'm sure the kidnapper wants what every kidnapper wants. To see you interview five to seven well-qualified fellowship candidates.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't need a team.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You were bouncing ideas off a janitor.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: And solved the case!

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Hi. I'm Dr. Cuddy. If you can hear what I'm saying, blink once.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You can't talk right now. You have a tube down your throat. And try not to move your head. You've been in a terrible accident. But it looks like you will have no permanent injuries. You've had a bad fever, but it's gone now.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: I've been here the whole time, honey, okay? I'm not leavin'.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: This is very important. I need you to blink one for "yes", twice for "no". Were you seeing a psychiatrist?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Were you on MAO Inhibitors? The antidepressant.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Megan, it's okay. It doesn't matter, okay? I love you.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Megan, are you all right?

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: What's happening? Are we upsetting her?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Heart is beating too fast. Get the family out of here.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Charging to two hundred.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Meg, Meg.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: We shocked her back into sinus rhythm, but she's still tachycardic.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fascinating. Equally fascinating is… why are you here?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I was gonna leave you alone if you won the bet. But you lost.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I explained the fever. Which is all we were talking about.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She confirmed the antidepressants. Go bet with someone else if you want to explain the heart problems.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: She confirmed them by winking. Maybe there was a cute guy across the room.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She got better when I treated her. Even I'm not that cute.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Two unrelated symptoms, just a coincidence. Or… you're grasping at straws to avoid admitting you can't do this on your own.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine, what explains the fever and persistent tachycardia?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It could be anything. Endocarditis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope. Fever, no infection.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Keep going, you're doing great.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You win.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I don't believe you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not gonna play this game. Just give me the damn résumés.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: And my guitar.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I don't have it. Although I did hear some plangent strumming from under that couch earlier.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Wow. This kidnapper isn't just bold, he's diabolical. I guess he realized he probably shouldn't give it back to you until after you've had the interviews.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Huh! You didn't write anything. So what you're saying is, you didn't find that one big explanation… 'cause there isn't one. Clever.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, let's just say, your antidepressant theory does explain the fever. What about the heart? And don't say a building fell on her.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay… A structure collapsed…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Come on, it fits. Crushed musculature releases potassium, causes V-Tach.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You'd think she'd get Crush Syndrome after she was crushed, not two days later.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Microvascular occlusions. Takes that long for the blood to reperfuse.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: She'd have a baggy heart. Echo it to confirm.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Is Crush Syndrome good or bad?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Does it sound good?

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: I mean, compared to the other things it could be.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: There are no other things it could be.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Excellent question.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The heart's fine.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Why is she sweating? Her fever's back.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I can't say.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: You don't know?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I know, I just can't say. 'Cause you'll hit me. Let's discuss this in front of witnesses.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: So she's an alcoholic now?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Her first fever was from the medication for her depression.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Or you're wrong.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The second fever was from the self-medication for depression.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: This is insane. You don't think I would have noticed her being constantly drunk?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You were practically living with Sylvia Plath. You didn't notice that.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Tone it down or I will hit you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine, I'll do liver enzyme tests.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Liver enzymes can also be elevated from musculoskeletal trauma. They'd be there whether she had a drinking problem or not.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: They don't know that. Just pretend to confirm.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: She's not an alcoholic.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hair of the dog, IV alcohol. Taper it off after a few days.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: She's sick and traumatized and half-dead. And you wanna make her drunk.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: You can't do this. We lived together, we were gonna have kids. You barely even knew her.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi, could I speak to Trevor… Kaufman?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Yo, yo, it's Trev. What up?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: This is Dr. Gregory House. Can you come in tomorrow to interview?

utterance.speaker: TREVOR KAUFMAN
utterance.content: House? Are you serious? Awesome! Hey, dude, I got the House interview!

utterance.speaker: TREVOR KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Dude, shut up! I'm on the phone! Shut-up!

utterance.speaker: TREVOR KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Give me the phone back.

utterance.speaker: TREVOR KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Give me the phone back!

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I got a page.

utterance.speaker: MALE NURSE
utterance.content: No, you didn't.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: They called a code.

utterance.speaker: MALE NURSE
utterance.content: No, they didn't.

utterance.speaker: MALE NURSE
utterance.content: You got a page, but not from us.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you ever see "Raid on Entebbe"?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah, in the end, they released the hostages. How's that working for you?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The Ugandans played fair. They didn't move the hostages on the Israelis.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Once again, I am in awe of the kidnapper's tactical brilliance.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What is "El Fuego Del Amor" and why do you need ten of them?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's a Telenovela. I'm learning Spanish.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Say adios.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Are you erasing my TiVo? House, not the season finale!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't negotiate with terrorists. I smoke them out of their hidey-holes.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Do you know what terrorists do when you don't negotiate? They terrorize.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Bring-it-on.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Fever's down. Sweating has abated. Heart's working fine. Guess House was right. Again.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It is good news.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: So what does this mean, she's an alcoholic? There's no other explanation?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: No, sorry.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: It doesn't make any sense.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: It's been on and off for the last couple hours. Is she trying to talk?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: No. I think she's screaming.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Morning!

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Where did you come from?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Apes, if you believe the Democrats. I heard you were there when I was proven right. The alcohol treatment took away the heart and fever problems.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes, I was also there when you were proven wrong. She'd been silently screaming for two hours.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Amylase and lipase are through the roof. She has pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: IV alcohol can cause pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not gonna argue with me?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You think I'm right?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not really a "Yes or No" question.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Which is why I'm not answering it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If it's not the IV alcohol, it's gotta be the…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Not interested.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If I'm wrong, she's gonna die. Are you sure you're still Dean of Medicine?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm not interested in arguing because I'm not interested in enabling you. You need someone to bounce ideas off of. You need a team.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Don't follow me.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: MAO Inhibitor caused the fever. Alcohol caused the pancreatitis. Alcohol withdrawal caused the V-Tach

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: "Your logic is irrefutable."

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You're wrong.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, who're you gonna believe? A classic toy or a woman who, if she had any confidence in her ideas, wouldn't feel the need to distract you with a water bra?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Are you really just gonna treat the pancreatitis?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Are you here to enable me?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't want her to die because you're stubborn.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Wow, so you can enable and rationalize at the same time. I guess you are still Dean of Medicine.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: If you're right, then this guy, who's not an ass, who's not a workaholic, who's not a sociopath, has somehow missed both her depression and severe alcoholism.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, imagine that, a couple with secrets.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Why would she lie?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Okay, alcoholism you don't wanna advertise. But…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: If you're right, there'd be an abnormality on the pancreas. At least do an MRI to confirm.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Oh… my… God.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: This guy means business. Or guys. Could be, could be multiple… Could be multiple guys. Or a gal. Who knows? All I can say is, this reeks of boldness.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I am not hiring a team.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You ever tighten a guitar string really, really slowly?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Past the point it can handle the strain? It makes this weird… sound.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Almost like a scream.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: I thought this was gonna be fun. I mess with you, you mess with me. Eventually, you give in. But you've shown a startling lack of humor, which got me thinking.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What's the real reason you won't hire a team?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I told you, I don't need a team.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Then hire three people and let 'em sit on their asses.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That wouldn't be right.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Three years ago, you hired a team. What's changed?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I've become a man of principle. I've gotten smarter. What answer will make Socrates shut up?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What's changed is, you hired a team. You connected with a team. You worked with a team. And you lost a team.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Damn. There's no abnormalities in her pancreas.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You fall in love, you get married. Fifty percent chance it'll end in misery. Hiring employees can be even tougher. Because you know, eventually, they're gonna leave.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: There's increased T2 signal on her hepatic capsule. If you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You got hurt. Get over it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Now, if you'll excuse me, my patient is about to start bleeding out of her mouth and anus.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Internal bleeding.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not anymore. Now it's all over the place.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That's my patient down there.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You're here because I'm here. I am done enabling you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: The alcohol didn't cause the pancreatitis, the internal bleeding did. The question is, what caused the internal bleeding? I hate myself.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You do know that the patient had a building land on her.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Four days ago.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Bleeding can start at any time.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It's bleeding from five different sites. You think they synchronized their watches?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She got warfarin after her hip surgery. It's designed to mess with bleeding patterns.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Fever, heart and bleeding. Three problems, three completely different explanations. She must be the unluckiest woman in the world.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I only cling to this crazy theory because it's been proven right every step of the way. Each treatment worked.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes, she looks perfectly healthy. This much bleeding is a symptom of something more. And you need a team because you're wrong and you're gonna kill this woman.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If I had a team, this patient would be dead. Because they'd be here instead of me and they wouldn't notice the size of this woman's uterus.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi! How's it going? Mind if I observe?

utterance.speaker: SURGEON
utterance.content: Got a big room up top with a big window just for that.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, stop that.

utterance.speaker: SURGEON
utterance.content: You wanna look at vaginas, there are websites for that.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Am I made of money?

utterance.speaker: SURGEON
utterance.content: Can you get him out of here?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Enlarged uterus. Means that she was recently pregnant. She's a good liar, but I doubt she could hide a baby from her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Scraping in the uterus indicates that she had an abortion. But nothing in her medical history. Only one reason to hide an abortion. Boyfriend wants babies, she doesn't.

utterance.speaker: SURGEON
utterance.content: She's bleeding everywhere. Unless the guy was performing an abortion with a shotgun…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Stop enabling him!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not the abortion, it's what she did after. The boyfriend would have noticed condoms. He would notice abstinence. He would not notice the pill. Which means, I don't need a team!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey, where's your mother-in-common-law?

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Dr. House, this is Doug McMurtry. His girlfriend was working with Megan when…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's dead?

utterance.speaker: DOUB MCMURTRY
utterance.content: She passed this morning.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, then why are you still here?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I need the old lady's consent to do some treatment.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: What'd you find out?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I wish I could tell you, but since you're not legally related…

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: What the hell did you did you find out?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Your girlfriend had an abortion. See why I didn't tell you? I'd be insane to also tell you that she's on the pill.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: N-No, she's not.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If they'd known she was on it, they wouldn't have given her a blood thinner after her hip surgery. The combination caused the bleeding. It's good news. It's treatable. Just give her tamoxifen. Which is normally a breast cancer…

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: It's not true. 'Cause, uh, we wanna have kids.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hmm, I already did the blood tests. Either she lied to you, or her blood lied to us.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Tell Megan I'm glad she's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: How ya doing?

utterance.speaker: SAM LEE
utterance.content: I got cancer.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're on an oncology ward. Everybody's got cancer. You want sympathy, you wanna try the "hardly anything wrong with me" ward. In fact, why don't I take you there right now?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: How sick are you? Can you walk?

utterance.speaker: SAM LEE
utterance.content: Are you a doctor?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Admitted today. First day of a five-day chemo course. Yeah, you can walk. C'mon, let's go.

utterance.speaker: SAM LEE
utterance.content: Does Dr. Wilson know you're here?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, if he didn't, this would be really stupid. 'Cause then he wouldn't know where his patient was. Might think he'd been kidnapped. Now the room upstairs is bigger. It's got cable. Better looking sponge-bath nurses.

utterance.speaker: SAM LEE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If you feel sick, you call me directly, not Dr. Wilson. He's getting his last set of hormone shots.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You put her on tamoxifen? An anti-cancer drug?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: It blocks estrogen receptors.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Does it also block breathing and kidney function? She's crashing.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't mean I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: This is Dr. Martin. We're bringing his patient over now, thanks.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Anybody here a doctor? Kidney failure, spiking fever, breathing difficulties. Any theories?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Am I in an M. Night Shyamalan movie?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: You're House, right?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, I assume you know me because I once insulted you, your patient, or your relatives. If that's so, I apologize. I was drunk that day. Patient initially presented with crush injuries.

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: I know you because Dr. Cuddy issued a memo.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Telling you to cooperate fully with me?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Figured that was a long shot. Anybody here not get that memo?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: Fungal infection.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't you have a patient?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: She shot herself in the leg while high on meth. Wouldn't hurt her to be in pain for a little while.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fungal infection would be in her eyes by now.

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: Haemophilus.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't explain the remitting fever.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You've heard that I've got a job opening, right?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: I just care about people. Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: ARDS doesn't explain anything. Except the breathing. If you care about people, you're not getting the job.

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: I was lying. Crush Syndrome.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't explain the breathing. What was the problem with ARDS?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: Only explained the breathing.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: And the Crush Syndrome?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: It didn't explain the breathing.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You a fan of symmetry?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Weird. 'Cause your eyes are lopsided. And by eyes, I mean breasts. ARDS And Crush Syndrome, both reactions to severe trauma. Why can't she have both?

utterance.speaker: YOUNG DOCTOR
utterance.content: Because… because then there's nothing we could do.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Boy, you remind me of someone.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Send me your résumé. I'll put it on top of the pile that I'm… never gonna look at.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: I couldn't leave.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't seem like the type of person who would give up on giving up.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: I love her.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You love somebody. Somebody who didn't drink, who wanted to have babies. And wasn't miserable.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: I know she lied, but…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The woman you love doesn't exist. This woman is dying. She has Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome and Crush Syndrome. Her body's basically giving up. We can keep her on supportive dialysis and hope for the best.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Never mind. She has a lump on her arm.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Does that mean you're wrong?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That would be good news for you guys. We'll know after the biopsy.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Which patient is that?

utterance.speaker: IMELDA
utterance.content: Megan…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: House's patient.

utterance.speaker: IMELDA
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Didn't you get my memo?

utterance.speaker: IMELDA
utterance.content: Sure. Got both memos.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Both. And the second memo said to ignore the first memo?

utterance.speaker: IMELDA
utterance.content: Yep. Seemed odd. Did an MRI and…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: 'Course you did.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: What'd you find?

utterance.speaker: IMELDA
utterance.content: It's kind of freaky. She's got growths all over the place.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: She's got tumors?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Not exactly. The growths are eosinophilic granulomas. They are usually from allergic reactions. I'm putting her on steroids.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: We don't know. Unfortunately, the only drug she's had enough of to have this kind of reaction is cephalosporin.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Because she was on it two months ago. That's what you mean, right? She… took it for strep throat, so she can't be allergic to it.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It would seem so.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Mr. Lee, I just have to check…

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Sam? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What're you doing here?

utterance.speaker: MALE NURSE
utterance.content: I was taking a nap.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Where's my patient?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You stole my patient.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You kidnapped my guitar.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Give him back.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Only when you give her back.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's a "she"?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, it's certainly not a dude.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: It's a guitar! You took a human being!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Now who doesn't have a sense of humor? I'm monitoring the guy remotely.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What are you, listening for the distant sound of screaming?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The nurses know to call me.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: They don't know who he is!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: His name's right there on the chart. Now go away. I'm working.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: They give him the wrong meds, who the hell knows what's gonna happen?

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Bad things would happen.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He's in room three-one-eight.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Megan? Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Nothing? What-what-what's going on? What's wrong with her?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Her? Nothing.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Just some amphetamines to wake her up. Everything could be explained by her lying to you. The antidepressants, the drinking, the pill. Until now. Now she's allergic to something the chart says she's not allergic to. That's not her lying, that's the chart lying. Which doesn't make sense.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you know a Liz Masters?

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Yeah, she worked with Megan. That was her boyfriend who you met outside the morgue.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hmm. This is her chart. She's on MAO Inhibitors for depression. She's on the pill. She had an abortion a month ago. And she's allergic to cephalosporin.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: What's going on here? What, are you saying this isn't Megan?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Ben.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BRADBERRY
utterance.content: Since right before I began pretending I loved it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She's the same size as Megan, same build, same hair color.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: They were both horribly injured. Unrecognizably. EMT teams do not second guess family members' identifications at accident scenes.

utterance.speaker: BEN PROSNER
utterance.content: No. Liz died yesterday. This isn't Liz. I know Megan. I know her hair. I know her hands. I know her smell. Oh.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What's your name?

utterance.speaker: LIZ MASTERS
utterance.content: Liz…

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Your girlfriend never lied to you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I did it all by myself, mommy.

utterance.speaker: LEON THE JANITOR
utterance.content: You talking to me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Go away.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I did it all by myself, mommy.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: How'd you know it was me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: There's a scent given off by wounded, feral cats.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You were wrong.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I got everything right. Just treated the wrong…

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: They had a good relationship.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He couldn't even identify her.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: And you were wrong about needing a team. She almost died.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: So I almost need a team.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You were content with your "people are idiots" theory. But Cameron would never have accepted that this guy knew nothing about the love of his life. And as soon as you claimed it was multiple conditions, Foreman would have done anything to prove you wrong. And then, Chase would have done anything to prove you right. Any one of them would have solved this days ago. Hire a team. I don't care how you do it. Just do it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Sometimes, I am wrong. I have a gift for observation. For reading people in situations. But sometimes, I am wrong. This will be the longest job interview of your life. I will test you in ways that you will often consider unfair, demeaning and illegal. And you will often be right. Look to your left. Now look to your right. By the end of six weeks, one of you will be gone. As will twenty-eight more of you. Wear a cup.
